subject: Command Line Arguments
msgSnippet: Hi, I am new to JUnit and Pisces. My problem is, I have three files (one is my test suit, second is test case and third is java file to be tested). I want am
messageBody:
Hi,

I am new to JUnit and Pisces. My problem is, I have three files (one is my test suit, second is test case and third is java file to be tested). I want am giving a command having a command line argument:
java -classpath E:\books\junit3.8.1\junit\suntsc\;E:\books\junit3.8.1\junit.jar -DmyParam=myvariable junit.textui.TestRunner AllTests
I want to pass this variable (myParam) to my third file (i.e. my java file) from my TESTSUIT. Could you please tell me how and where to send it?

1) First is Test Suit:
public class AllTests extends TestSuite {
public String myTestString;
public static Test suite () {
MulticastRemoteTestCommunicationLayer com = new MulticastRemoteTestCommunicationLayer( RemoteTestRunner.name,"228.4.19.76", 6767);
RemoteTestRunner.setCom(com);
TestSuite suite = new ActiveTestSuite("Test for org.pisces.testers");
myTestString = System.getProperty("myParam");
RemoteTestCase rtc1 = RemoteTestCase.wrap(TestSenderReceiver.class,"testSender", "sunremote2");
suite.addTest(rtc1);
return suite;
}
}

2) Second is Test Case:
public class TestSenderReceiver extends TestCase {
public void testSender() {
System.out.println("TEST " + super.myTestString);
//SOME TEST IS CONDUCTED USING THIS VALUE
}
}

3) My java file that I want to test.


Sincerely Yours,
Sunil
